duties_responsibilities.duty: Conduct or manage R&D testing to confirm design or process changes are suitable and acceptable.
Support medical device Verification and Validation (V&V) activities by writing technical documents, conducting testing, and managing service providers.
Take a proactive role in managing relations with contract manufacturing organizations involved in the production of the dry eye treatment.
Maintain comprehensive design control and quality assurance documentation in compliance with regulatory requirements.
Provide general support for regulatory activities and contribute to the development of strategies to obtain necessary approvals and clearances for the product's commercialization.
Support clinical operations and data integrity by developing research findings into actions to support project objectives.
Explore complex technical or marketing challenges by interacting with company experts, project stakeholders, or independent consultants.
Act as a capable problem-solver, identifying and addressing challenges that may arise during the commercialization process and collaborating with cross-functional teams to find innovative solutions.
Present data, research topics, or product information to the team or external partners.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in mechanical, biomedical, or chemical engineering (or related field) (Master's preferred)
